meanings.definition: Condoes (verb): to give approval or permission
meanings.sent1: She condones his decision to stay up late to finish his homework.
meanings.sent2: The teacher condones students helping each other during group work.
meanings.sent3: The parents condone the children's messy room as a sign of creativity.
meanings.sent4: Her silence seemed to condone his reckless behavior.
meanings.sent5: The boss's smile condones the team's hard work.

meanings.definition: Condoes (noun): a type of housing unit in a multi-unit complex
meanings.sent1: Their condoes have a beautiful view of the city skyline.
meanings.sent2: The condoes in the building have modern amenities for residents.
meanings.sent3: The condoes in the complex are painted in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent4: The rows of condoes resemble colorful blocks in a toy set.
meanings.sent5: Each of the condoes has a unique charm that sets it apart from the others.
